result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Haynes, Steven A

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Carmen Lassiter.  Report which has been received states the deft is not competent and is not likely to become competent w/in the time period allowed by law.  Atty Lassiter reports the deft is presently under Chapter 51 proceedings.  SW Edith Rita present in court as well.  SW Rita reports she is working on getting the deft back in his previous group home.  Deft is discharged from the commitment and remains in the custody of the sheriff under authority of the Chapter 51 proceedings.  Deft to remain in the custody of the sheriff pending placement at the group home w/in 48 hours.  If no action has been taken w/in 48 hours, the deft shall be returned to court.  SW Rita contacted the Group Home and reports the bed is open for the deft.  Per Court, file may be closed.

ADDRESS INFO for Steven A Haynes
Current: 6024 18 Av, Trans Corp Transitional Living, Kenosha, WI 53143 United States  (Effective: 11-13-2014)
Prior: 521 59th Street #704, Kenosha, WI 53140

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Val Karls.  Testimony taken from Dr. Brooke Lundbohm.  Court finds the deft is not competent at this time but is likely to become competent w/in the time prescribed by law.  Deft is committed to the Dept of Health for a period of year; place of treatment to determined by the Dept.  If in-patient is required, the Sheriff's Dept will provide the transport.  Atty Karls provided the deft's new address as well as contact number for the supervisor Lena at the transitional living facility.  RH set for 2/10/15 @ 9am
Competency hearing on November 13, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Competency hearing on October 16, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Drew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Atty Val Karls appeared on behalf of deft.  Deft not present; Atty Karls reports that typically the deft is transferred from the CBRF facility to the court by one of his aides.  Per court, State to set up a conference call with Atty Karls, the court, & the witness (doctor) to find a mutually agreeable date for the competency hrg.  NOTE - deft appeared @ 11:30am with an aide.  The aide reports that the social worker told her the hrg was at 11:30am.  Court informs the aide that a notice will be sent of the next court date.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Valerie Karls.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Competency report indicates def. is not competent to proceed.  Defendant disagrees with that finding.  Competency hearing 9/12/14 at 11:00.  Def. will present testimony from def.'s psychiatrist (by phone) and the State will call psychologist Brooke Lundbohm to testify by phone.  Bond continued.
Report by Brooke E. Lundbohm, Psy.D., of Wisconsin Forensic Unit
Order for Competency Exam and email correspondence from Vicki Shequen WISCS to Janice Koehne Re: order for comp  Form CR-205
File sent to Rm 157 for signature on Order for Exam.

Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Val Karls. Clerk LE. Case was scheduled for preliminary hearing this morning. Atty. Karls raises issue of competency. Court orders competency hearing under 971.14, to be performed by Milwaukee Forensic Unit, out-patient. Report to be filed within 30 days. Competency hearing on 8-12-14 @ 11:00am. Bond continued.
Val Karls.

228 p.m.  Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney E King.  Clk  LE.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Comm Mason on 7/17/14 @ 9 a.m.   $2500 Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).
